neighbors.name: Richard L. Kelley, Ruth A. Kelley, Zachary J. Kelley
neighbors.claims: The Kelley family were among the local landowners who submitted formal letters opposing Plus Power’s proposed battery energy storage facility in Saline County [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/). County commissioners later acknowledged the widespread resident opposition and voted 4–1 to deny the project’s permit, overriding a prior unanimous planning board approval [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local farm family; no official roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Kelley family through a respected local farm leader who can discuss safety and land-use protections. Emphasize commitments to preserving their farmland’s integrity and ensuring the project will not diminish their property’s value or legacy.

neighbors.name: Bebe Davis Tucker
neighbors.claims: Bebe Davis Tucker is a rural Saline County landowner who joined other neighbors in formally protesting a proposed battery energy storage development in the area [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/). Local officials noted that most nearby landowners (including Tucker) opposed the facility, often citing fire safety fears and threats to the area’s rural character in their objections [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime resident landowner; no public office

approach_recommendations.engage: A one-on-one approach via a trusted local neighbor or community elder is recommended. Emphasize that the project will maintain the quiet, rural lifestyle she values and provide assurances that her property’s safety and value will be protected throughout the project.

neighbors.name: Rodney A. Bradshaw
neighbors.claims: Rodney A. Bradshaw is a Saline County landowner who took part in the organized opposition against Plus Power’s battery storage plan, signing formal protest submissions alongside other local landholders [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/). In response to the unified neighbor pushback, county commissioners highlighted public safety concerns and preservation of the rural community when they voted 4–1 to reject the project’s permit [CitizenJournal](https://www.citizenjournal.us/commission-rejects-battery-storage-facility-despite-planning-board-approval/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local landowner; no known civic positions

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Bradshaw through a fellow farmer or county extension agent who can address technical safety measures (e.g. fire prevention) and reassure him that agricultural use of the land will remain largely unaffected. Highlight any community benefits that align with preserving the rural way of life.

overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have expressed opposition to the proposed energy development in Saline County, with none voicing support. They are private landowners without formal public offices, so their influence is grassroots rather than through official authority.
